oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prevention
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilroth, T. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: internal parasite
control program
nutrition
reinfestation
feedlot
cattle
sheep
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Any internal parasite control program involves more than one phase, and that is therapeutic worming. We like to think it involves, first of all, a high plane of nutrition, consequently a high state of health. The second part of any effective total parasite control program, we feel, of course, is the prevention of reinfestation on pasture. Now, I am talking about pastured animals whether they be cattle or sheep. I am not talking about feedlot programs which are different, as you know.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1971; 129-130
